intro: Ficinia tristachya var. tribracteata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves arranged in dense clusters. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets, which are a defining feature of the Cyperaceae family. It thrives in wet or marshy environments and is often found in riparian zones. Its botanical structure makes it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
